glsa.title: GnuTLS: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in GnuTLS, allowing for easier man-in-the-middle attacks.

background.p: GnuTLS is an Open Source implementation of the TLS 1.2 and SSL 3.0 protocols.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GnuTLS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: An attacker could perform man-in-the-middle attacks to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority or to inject an arbitrary amount of chosen plaintext into the beginning of the application protocol stream, allowing for further exploitation.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GnuTLS users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since August 6, 2010. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
